Class: Invite

Invite

An Invite to a Conversation can be accepted or rejected.

Invites are raised by Client#event:invite.

Properties:
Name Type Description
conversationSid string

The SID of the Conversation this Invite is for
from string

The remote Client that sent this Invite
participants Array.<string>

The identities of the Participants currently in the Conversation
status string

The status of this Invite, either "accepted", "rejected", "canceled", or "pending"
to Client

The recipient Client of this Invite
Source:
  • invite.js, line 36
Fires:
  • Invite#event:accepted
  • Invite#event:canceled
  • Invite#event:failed
  • Invite#event:rejected

Methods

accept(optionsopt) → {Promise.<Conversation>}

Accept the Invite and join the Conversation.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
options Invite#AcceptOptions <optional>
 {localStreamConstraints:{audio:true,video:true}}

Options to override Invite#accept's default behavior
Source:
  • invite.js, line 184
Fires:
  • Invite#event:accepted
  • Invite#event:failed
Returns:
Type
Promise.<Conversation>
Example
var initialToken = getAccessToken();
var manager = new Twilio.AccessManager(initialToken);
var client = new Twilio.Conversations.Client(manager);

client.on('invite', function(invite) {
  console.log('Received Invite to join a Conversation with ' + invite.from);

  // By default, accept will request the microphone and camera for you.
  invite.accept();
});

reject()

Reject the Invite to a Conversation.

Source:
  • invite.js, line 236
Fires:
  • Invite#event:rejected
Example
var initialToken = getAccessToken();
var manager = new Twilio.AccessManager(initialToken);
var client = new Twilio.Conversations.Client(manager);

client.on('invite', function(invite) {
  console.log('Rejecting Invite to join a Conversation with ' + invite.from);
  invite.reject();
});

Type Definitions

AcceptOptions

You may pass these options to Invite#accept to override the default behavior.

Type:
  • object
Properties:
Name Type Attributes Default Description
localMedia LocalMedia <optional>
<nullable>
 null

Set to reuse an existing LocalMedia object when accepting an Invite
localStream MediaStream <optional>
<nullable>
 null

Set to reuse an existing MediaStream when accepting an Invite
localStreamConstraints object <optional>
<nullable>
 {audio:true,video:true}

Set to override the parameters passed to getUserMedia when neither localMedia nor localStream are provided
Source:
  • invite.js, line 272

accepted

The Invite was accepted, and the Client is now participating in the Conversation.
